actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 1:00 p.m. on May 9, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Grothman moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency declared with respect to Yemen in Executive Order 13611 of May 16, 2012, is to continue in effect beyond May 16, 2025
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 119-50).
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

Considered by unanimous consent. S. Con. Res. 12 — "Authorizing the use of Emancipation Hall in the Capitol Visitor Center for a ceremony to present the Congressional Gold Medal, collectively, to the United States Army Rangers Veterans of World War II."
Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.

Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Friday, May 9, 2025, it adjourn to meet on Tuesday, May 13, 2025, at noon for Morning-Hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 1:00 p.m. on May 9. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by recorded vote: 211
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 203

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mr. Huffman moved to recommit to the Committee on Natural Resources.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 276.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 276 and H.R. 881. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 276 and H.R. 881 under a closed rule with one hour of debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 377. H.R. 276 — "To rename the Gulf of Mexico as the "Gulf of America"."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Garcia of TX to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Rev. Dr. Charles B. Jackson, Sr., Brookland Baptist Church, West Columbia, South Carolina.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
